original: @157b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @157b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya dz'am gu l'i ma h'a bidy'a /
analyzed: a'arya dz'am gu l'i ma h'a bidy'a /
translated: Āryajāṅgulīmahāvidyā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags ma dug sel ma'i rig sngags chen mo /
analyzed: 'phags ma dug sel ma'i rig sngags chen mo /
translated: The Great Knowledge Mantra of Noble Jāngulī

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time,

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan du yod pa na bzhugs te /
translated: the Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī,

original: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po brgya phrag phyed dang bcu gsum dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
translated: in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada, together with a great saṅgha of 1,250 monks,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dang / yang dpag tu med pa'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dang / yang dpag tu med pa'i lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
translated: and with a great many bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and with innumerable gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas,

original: mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams dang thabs cig go //
analyzed: mi dang mi ma yin pa rnams dang thabs cig go //
translated: humans, and non-humans.

original: de nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: In that very text, the Blessed One said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag sngon byung pa na nga byang chub sems dpar gyur te spyad pa spyod pa na /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung pa na nga byang chub sems dpar gyur te spyad pa spyod pa na /
translated: “Monks, in the past, when I was a bodhisattva practicing the conduct,

original: ri bo gangs ldan byang phyogs logs //
analyzed: ri bo gangs ldan byang phyogs logs //
translated: in the northern region of the snowy mountains,

original: spos ngad ldang ba'i ri bo ste //
analyzed: spos ngad ldang ba'i ri bo ste //
translated: on the mountain of rising incense,

original: ri rgyal de yi shar phyogs na //
analyzed: ri rgyal de yi shar phyogs na //
translated: in the east of that king of mountains,

original: gzhon nu bsod nams brgya yis mtshan //
analyzed: gzhon nu bsod nams brgya yis mtshan //
translated: the youth with a hundred merits,

original: ae na ya yi pags pa'i gos //
analyzed: ae na ya yi pags pa'i gos //
translated: wearing the skin of an enaya,

original: sbrul gyis brgyan cing ske rags byas //
analyzed: sbrul gyis brgyan cing ske rags byas //
translated: adorned with snakes, using a snake as a belt,

original: sbrul dug reg pa'i dug can @158a * //
analyzed: sbrul dug reg pa'i dug can @158a * //
translated: with poisonous snakes that kill by touch

original: dang ; / mthong dug can gyis rna rgyan byas //
analyzed: dang ; / mthong dug can gyis rna rgyan byas //
translated: and poisonous snakes that kill by sight as earrings,

original: dug gi me tog zas su za //
analyzed: dug gi me tog zas su za //
translated: eating poisonous flower food,

original: dug gi khrag ni 'thung bar byed //
analyzed: dug gi khrag ni 'thung bar byed //
translated: drinking poisonous blood,

original: de yi bdag la bos byas te //
analyzed: de yi bdag la bos byas te //
translated: he called out to me:

original: bu khyod tshur shog bdag la nyon //🔽dug sel ma zhes bya ba yi //
analyzed: bu khyod tshur shog bdag la nyon // dug sel ma zhes bya ba yi //
translated: ‘Son, come here and listen to me!🔽The supreme knowledge mantra

original: rig sngags mchog gis dug 'joms ma //
analyzed: rig sngags mchog gis dug 'joms ma //
translated: called ‘Destroyer of Poison’ destroys poison.

original: gang zhig bdag ming tsam gyis kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag ming tsam gyis kyang //
translated: By merely uttering my name,

original: de yi dug rnams thams cad 'joms //
analyzed: de yi dug rnams thams cad 'joms //
translated: it destroys all his poisons.

original: tadya th'a / aom ai li mitte ti li mitte ai li ti li mitte dumbe li dumb'a li aa gra dusse dussa l'i ai tarke takra ra na merme marmma ra ne kashm'i re kashm'i ra mu kte aaghe aagha ne aagha na gha ne aa gha na gha ne ai l'i ai
analyzed: tadya th'a / aom ai li mitte ti li mitte ai li ti li mitte dumbe li dumb'a li aa gra dusse dussa l'i ai tarke takra ra na merme marmma ra ne kashm'i re kashm'i ra mu kte aaghe aagha ne aagha na gha ne aa gha na gha ne ai l'i ai
translated: tadyathā: oṃ ilite tilite ilite tilite ilite tilite dumbelim dumbalim agradusse dussa lī itarke takrarane mere meramaraṇe kṣamīre kṣamīra mukte aghe agha ne agha nagha ne agha nagha ne ilai

original: l'i / ae ma li ae ai li mi l'i ae aaksh'a ae aaksha /
analyzed: l'i / ae ma li ae ai li mi l'i ae aaksh'a ae aaksha /
translated: lāi, emalim e ilai milāi e akṣa e akṣa

original: ai ae shve te shve te tunde aa nu rakshe sv'ah'a /
analyzed: ai ae shve te shve te tunde aa nu rakshe sv'ah'a /
translated: i e śvete śvete tuṇḍe anurakṣe svāhā.

original: 'dir bdag gis rig sngags thams cad du dkar ba dge slong rnams la legs par phul ba'i rig pa 'di lan cig thos pas de la lo bdun du sprul gyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir bdag gis rig sngags thams cad du dkar ba dge slong rnams la legs par phul ba'i rig pa 'di lan cig thos pas de la lo bdun du sprul gyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, I have offered this knowledge to all the monks, the pure ones. By hearing this knowledge just once, for seven years they will not be seized by snakes.

original: de'i lus la dug gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i lus la dug gis gos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Poison will not touch their bodies.

original: dge slong gang zhig rnams kyis rig sngags 'di bzung bar gyur na ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sbrul gyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gang zhig rnams kyis rig sngags 'di bzung bar gyur na ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sbrul gyis 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If any monks uphold this knowledge, for as long as they live they will not be seized by snakes.

original: gal te yang sbrul gyis bzung na de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang sbrul gyis bzung na de'i mgo aardza ka'i dog pa bzhin du tshal pa bdun du 'gas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a snake bites him, its head will split into seven pieces like the seed-pod of the Arjaka plant.

original: yang sngags kyi tshig 'di sbrul gyi mdun du bzlas par mi bya'o//
analyzed: yang sngags kyi tshig 'di sbrul gyi mdun du bzlas par mi bya'o//
translated: One should not recite this mantra in front of a snake.

original: gang zhig gis bzlas na sbrul 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gis bzlas na sbrul 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does recite it, the snake will die.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The mantra is:

original: ai la l'a tsi la l'a tsakko bakko kod ti mo ho mo hi ti ku ru d'a ku ru de ni ku ru de ti /
analyzed: ai la l'a tsi la l'a tsakko bakko kod ti mo ho mo hi ti ku ru d'a ku ru de ni ku ru de ti /
translated: Illa lacha kilacha koka kokati moho mohiti kuru da kuru deti kuru deti

original: pu ru d'a pu ru de ti ni pu ru d'a ni pu ru de ti /
analyzed: pu ru d'a pu ru de ti ni pu ru d'a ni pu ru de ti /
translated: puruda purudeti nipuruda ni purudeti

original: phutta phutta ra he phutta phutta /
analyzed: phutta phutta ra he phutta phutta /
translated: phutta phutta rahe phutta phutta

original: ttenta ra he /
analyzed: ttenta ra he /
translated: tenta rahe

original: n'a ge n'a gam ra he /🔽n'a gadta dtanta ra he /
analyzed: n'a ge n'a gam ra he / n'a gadta dtanta ra he /
translated: nage nage marahe🔽nagedata tanta rahe

original: sar pe sar pa ra he sar padta dtanta ra he /
analyzed: sar pe sar pa ra he sar padta dtanta ra he /
translated: sarpe sarpe marahe sarpedata tanta rahe

original: aatstshe aatstsha le ai ai la bi she /
analyzed: aatstshe aatstsha le ai ai la bi she /
translated: acche acchale acchalela vishe

original: sh'i te sh'i t'a ban ta le /
analyzed: sh'i te sh'i t'a ban ta le /
translated: shete shetavanta le

original: pha le pha la le /🔽tunde tu tunde /
analyzed: pha le pha la le / tunde tu tunde /
translated: phale phale le🔽tundetundetunde

original: tandi tandi te da ta sphu ta sphu ta sphu ta tu bi sham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: tandi tandi te da ta sphu ta sphu ta sphu ta tu bi sham sv'a h'a /
translated: tanti tanti tedata sphuta sphuta sphuta tu visham svaha

original: dge slong rnams kyis dug sel ma zhes bya ba'i rig sngags chen po lha dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang gnod sbyin dang / 'byung po 'dus pa thams cad la gsungs pa dang / gtam byas pa dang / nye bar bstan pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis dug sel ma zhes bya ba'i rig sngags chen po lha dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang gnod sbyin dang / 'byung po 'dus pa thams cad la gsungs pa dang / gtam byas pa dang / nye bar bstan pa dang /
translated: The bhikṣus have taught the great vidyā-mantra called ‘Removing Poison’ to all the assembled devas, asuras, nāgas, yakṣas, and bhūtas, and have spoken about it, revealed it,

original: rab tu lung bstan pa de thams cad de bzhin du mi bden pa ma lags te gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu lung bstan pa de thams cad de bzhin du mi bden pa ma lags te gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: and fully taught it. All of that is true, not false, and not otherwise.

original: de bden par 'gyur te ji lta ba de bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de bden par 'gyur te ji lta ba de bzhin du phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: That is true, and just as it is, it is unmistaken.

original: phyin ci ma log pas sangs rgyas kyi bden pa rjes su dran pa @158b dang ; chos kyi bden pa rjes su dran pa dang dge 'dun gyi bden pa rjes su dran pa dang / bden pa'i tshig gi bden pa rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pas sangs rgyas kyi bden pa rjes su dran pa @158b dang ; chos kyi bden pa rjes su dran pa dang dge 'dun gyi bden pa rjes su dran pa dang / bden pa'i tshig gi bden pa rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: Because of being unmistaken, one recollects the truth of the Buddha, recollects the truth of the Dharma, recollects the truth of the Saṅgha, and recollects the truth of the words of truth.

original: bden pa 'di dang bden pa'i tshig 'dis dug rnams dug med par gyur cig / d'a t'a ram gatstsha tu /
analyzed: bden pa 'di dang bden pa'i tshig 'dis dug rnams dug med par gyur cig / d'a t'a ram gatstsha tu /
translated: By this truth and these words of truth, may poisons become non-poisonous.

original: da sha d'a ram gatstsha tu /
analyzed: da sha d'a ram gatstsha tu /
translated: Dāṭāram gacchatu.🔽Daśa dāṭāram gacchatu.

original: aagni gatstsha tu /
analyzed: aagni gatstsha tu /
translated: agnicchastū

original: ku tyam gatstsha tu /🔽dza la gatstsha tu /
analyzed: ku tyam gatstsha tu / dza la gatstsha tu /
translated: kuṭyaṃ chastū🔽jalam chastū

original: stam bha gatstsha tu /🔽sh'antam gatstsha tu /
analyzed: stam bha gatstsha tu / sh'antam gatstsha tu /
translated: stambha chastū🔽śāntam chastū

original: svastya ya nam gatstsha tu /
analyzed: svastya ya nam gatstsha tu /
translated: svastyāyanam chastū

original: bh'u myam ni pa ta tu bi sham sv'a h'a /
analyzed: bh'u myam ni pa ta tu bi sham sv'a h'a /
translated: bhūmyani patatu viśva svāhā

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / kun dga' bo dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i 'khor rnams dang / lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri za dang / mi 'am ci dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / kun dga' bo dang / dge slong dang bcas pa'i 'khor rnams dang / lha dang mi dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / dri za dang / mi 'am ci dang /
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, Ānanda, the retinue of monks, and the assembly of gods, humans, asuras, garuḍas, gandharvas,

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / gnod sbyin dang / klu dang bcas pa'i 'khor de dag thams cad yi rangs te mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / gnod sbyin dang / klu dang bcas pa'i 'khor de dag thams cad yi rangs te mngon par dga'o //
translated: kinnaras, mahoragas, yakṣas, and nāgas were all delighted and overjoyed.

original: 'phags ma dug sel ma'i rig sngags chen mo rdzogs so//
analyzed: 'phags ma dug sel ma'i rig sngags chen mo rdzogs so//
translated: The noble Mahā-Ugraparivarta Sūtra is complete.
